DataElement.preferredName: Edit Over-ride Site International Classification of Diseases Oncology 1 (ICD-O-1) Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Area for retaining the ICD-O-1 primary site code entered before conversion to ICD-0-2.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Edit Over-ride Site International Classification of Diseases Oncology 1
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Area for retaining the ICD-O-1 primary site.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The type of change made to an element.:To take precedence over and countermand, thereby allowing an activity to continue despite a warning or error.

Concepts.definition: The type of change made to an element.
To take precedence over and countermand, thereby allowing an activity to continue despite a warning or error.

Property.preferredName: Site International Classification of Diseases Oncology One
Property.preferredDefinition: Position in relation to the surroundings.:A system of categories to which morbid entries are assigned according to established criteria. Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization (from ICD-10, p1). The Clinical Modifications, produced by the United States Dept. of Health and Human Services, are larger extensions used for morbidity and general epidemiological purposes, primarily in the U.S. (MSH2005_2004_10_12):The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties.:The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

Concepts.definition: A position in relation to its surroundings.

A system of categories to which morbid entries are assigned according to established criteria. Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization. The Clinical Modifications, produced by the United States Dept. of Health and Human Services, are larger extensions used for morbidity and general epidemiological purposes, primarily in the U.S.
The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties.
The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredName: Site International Classification of Disease for Oncology 1 (ICD-O-1) Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Position in relation to the surroundings._The International Classification of Disease for Oncology has been used for nearly 25 years as a tool for coding diagnoses of neoplasms in tumor and cancer registrars and in pathology laboratories. ICD-O is a dual classification with coding systems for both topography and morphology. The topography code describes the site of origin of the neoplasm. The morphology code describes the characteristics of the tumor itself, including its cell type and biologic activity. (from Amazon.com)_The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ICD-O is a dual classification with coding systems for both topography and morphology. The topography code describes the site of origin of the neoplasm. The morphology code describes the characteristics of the tumor itself, including its cell type and biologic activity. Concepts.longName: International Classification of Diseases for Oncology
Concepts.definition: The International Classification of Diseases for Oncology has been used for nearly 25 years as a tool for coding diagnoses of neoplasms in tumor and cancer registrars and in pathology laboratories. ICD-O is a dual classification with coding systems for both topography and morphology. The topography code describes the site of origin of the neoplasm. The morphology code describes the characteristics of the tumor itself, including its cell type and biologic activity. (from Amazon.com)
The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
